short_stay_rule: Up to 90 days in any 180-day period across the Schengen Area.
passport_validity: Must be valid for at least 3 months after the intended departure from Schengen, issued within the last 10 years.
health_insurance: Schengen-compliant travel insurance strongly recommended; EHIC/GHIC accepted for medical care.
work_vs_business: Business meetings and trade fairs visa-free. Paid work, even short-term, requires an Austrian permit or visa (e.g., Red-White-Red Card).
local_registration_rules: Hotel guests registered automatically. Private stays over 3 days may require registration with local authorities.
etias_status: ETIAS mandatory for British citizens from Q4 2026.
ees_status: EES in effect from 12 Oct 2025; all non-EU arrivals biometric registration required at airports, seaports, land borders; possible delays.
border_crossing_modes: Land, air, rail all see EES post-12 Oct 2025. Schengen-wide internal border-free travel.
overstay_penalties: Fines, immediate removal, or multi-year Schengen re-entry bans for overstays.
special_exemptions: Schengen/EU long-term residents exempt from short-stay limits.
notes_for_hr: Travel for meetings/events OK visa-free; paid work needs permit. Check passport validity and insurance. Watch for EES/ETIAS launch dates.
disclaimer: Informational only – not legal advice. Verify via official government sources.

short_stay_rule: Up to 90 days in any 180-day period in the Schengen Area.
passport_validity: At least 3 months beyond departure; issued in last 10 years.
health_insurance: Schengen insurance strongly advised; EHIC/GHIC usable for emergency care and pre-existing conditions.
work_vs_business: Business travel/workshops/meetings covered under visa-free rules. Paid work/employment requires local permit or visa.
local_registration_rules: Hotels register guests automatically. Over 3 months requires local registration.
etias_status: ETIAS required from Q4 2026 for UK nationals.
ees_status: EES mandatory from Oct 12, 2025 at all external borders.
border_crossing_modes: Land, sea, air all covered by EES. Schengen internal travel unrestricted.
overstay_penalties: Fines or Schengen re-entry bans for overstay.
special_exemptions: EU/Schengen residence holders exempt from ETIAS/short-stay limits.
notes_for_hr: Short meetings OK without visa; paid work prohibited. Check EES/ETIAS rollout for process. Ensure insurance and up-to-date passports.
disclaimer: Informational only – not legal advice. Verify via official government sources.

schengen_notes: Joined Schengen January 2025. Full removal of land/sea/air border checks.
short_stay_rule: Contributes to Schengen 90/180 rule. Days in Bulgaria count towards Schengen allowance.
passport_validity: At least 3 months beyond intended departure, issued within 10 years.
health_insurance: Schengen medical insurance highly recommended; EHIC/GHIC no longer valid.
work_vs_business: Business travel (meetings/conferences) permitted visa-free. Paid activities require Bulgarian work permit/visa.
local_registration_rules: Hotel guest police registration. Local address registration for private stays over 3 days may be needed.
etias_status: ETIAS mandatory for UK nationals from late 2026.
ees_status: EES in place from 12 Oct 2025 at airports, ports, and land borders.
border_crossing_modes: Land, air, sea EES roll-out now fully in effect for Bulgaria.
overstay_penalties: Administrative fines, possible bans from Schengen.
special_exemptions: Schengen/EU residence holders exempt from normal short-stay rules.
notes_for_hr: Travel for meetings OK, no paid work. Bulgaria counts toward Schengen 90/180. Prepare for new EES/ETIAS border checks.
disclaimer: Informational only – not legal advice. Verify via official government sources.

short_stay_rule: Up to 90 days in total Schengen Area in 180 days.
passport_validity: Must be valid for 3 months post-departure from Schengen, issued within last 10 years.
health_insurance: Schengen insurance recommended; EHIC/GHIC accepted.
work_vs_business: Meetings/events allowed visa-free. Paid work requires permit (e.g., for local contract work or employee posting).
local_registration_rules: Hotel and landlord police registration mandatory. Short private stays must be registered within 2 days.
etias_status: ETIAS mandatory from Q4 2026 for UK citizens.
ees_status: EES in effect from Oct 2025 at borders.
border_crossing_modes: Land/sea/air border EES; free internal travel.
overstay_penalties: Fines, entry ban into Schengen.
special_exemptions: Residents/permit holders have exemptions.
notes_for_hr: Business travel OK, paid work not allowed without permit. EES and ETIAS will add entry formalities for UK nationals.
disclaimer: Informational only – not legal advice. Verify via official government sources.

schengen_notes: EU but not part of Schengen. Schengen rules do not apply. Candidate for future accession.
short_stay_rule: 90 days in any 180 solely for Cyprus. Schengen 90/180 does not apply.
passport_validity: At least 3 months past exit, issued within last 10 years.
health_insurance: Travel insurance highly advised. EHIC/GHIC accepted in public hospitals for medically necessary treatment.
work_vs_business: Business meetings/trade fairs allowed visa-free up to 90 days. Paid work/employment requires a Cypriot work permit/visa.
local_registration_rules: Hotel registration required. No local guest registration for short stays.
etias_status: Cyprus is not yet in Schengen; ETIAS will apply only when/if Cyprus joins. No ETIAS in 2026.
ees_status: Cyprus not part of EES.
border_crossing_modes: Direct air/sea access. No land border into Schengen. North/South Green Line restrictions.
overstay_penalties: Fines/deportation for overstays.
special_exemptions: Residents/permit holders have local exemptions.
notes_for_hr: Cyprus is NOT in Schengen; separate 90-day rule. Business meetings fine, but paid work requires permit. Check passport validity.
disclaimer: Informational only – not legal advice. Verify via official government sources.

schengen_notes: Not part of Schengen. EU member. Forms Common Travel Area (CTA) with UK.
short_stay_rule: No time limit for UK/Irish citizens due to CTA.
passport_validity: No legal passport requirement for UK citizens, but airlines/ferries often require it for ID.
health_insurance: EHIC/GHIC accepted for emergencies. UK NHS still covers citizens resident in UK.
work_vs_business: No restrictions for British citizens under CTA on work; no business/paid activity limits.
local_registration_rules: No local registration needed for short stays or work.
etias_status: No ETIAS required for Ireland.
ees_status: No EES for Ireland; not a Schengen/EEA member.
border_crossing_modes: Direct air/sea. UK-Ireland land border is open (as of Oct 2025) due to CTA.
overstay_penalties: None under CTA for UK citizens.
special_exemptions: CTA covers British and Irish citizens for residence and work.
notes_for_hr: No time or business/work limits for British staff. Recommend passport as photo ID for travel. CTA covers travel, residence, work.
disclaimer: Informational only – not legal advice. Verify via official government sources.

ees_status: EES in force at all Czech external Schengen borders starting 12 Oct 2025.
border_crossing_modes: All external borders covered by EES; internal Schengen travel unrestricted.
overstay_penalties: Fines, possible ban from Schengen for overstays.
special_exemptions: Holders of Schengen residence permits exempt from short-stay limits.
notes_for_hr: Business OK 90 days; paid work needs permit. EES registration required; watch for ETIAS start date. Confirm passport insurance.
disclaimer: Informational only – not legal advice. Verify via official government sources.
